seg-source.mrk: derby.authentication.provider

target.mrk: derby.authentication.provider

seg-source.mrk: derby.authentication.provider

target.mrk: derby.authentication.provider

seg-source.mrk: Authentication provider

target.mrk: Authentication provider

seg-source.mrk: specifying

target.mrk: specifying

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication provider for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the authentication provider for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> user authentication.

target.mrk: Specifies the authentication provider for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Legal values include:

target.mrk: Legal values include:

seg-source.mrk: NATIVE:credentialsDB

target.mrk: NATIVE:credentialsDB

trans-unit.source: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB, a dedicated database, to store user credentials. This value must be set by using system-wide Java Virtual Machine (JVM) properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY system procedure. When this system-wide value is set, credentialsDB is used to authenticate all operations. Individual databases can override this directive by specifying their own value for derby.authentication.provider.

seg-source.mrk: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB, a dedicated database, to store user credentials.

This value must be set by using system-wide Java Virtual Machine (JVM) properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY system procedure.
When this system-wide value is set, credentialsDB is used to authenticate all operations.
Individual databases can override this directive by specifying their own value for derby.authentication.provider.

target.mrk: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB, a dedicated database, to store user credentials.

This value must be set by using system-wide Java Virtual Machine (JVM) properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY system procedure.
When this system-wide value is set, credentialsDB is used to authenticate all operations.
Individual databases can override this directive by specifying their own value for derby.authentication.provider.

trans-unit.source: The value of credentialsDB must be a valid name for a database.

seg-source.mrk: The value of credentialsDB must be a valid name for a database.

target.mrk: The value of credentialsDB must be a valid name for a database.

seg-source.mrk: NATIVE:credentialsDB:LOCAL

target.mrk: NATIVE:credentialsDB:LOCAL

trans-unit.source: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB for system-wide operations, but using an individual database's to authenticate connections to that database. This value must be set by using system-wide JVM properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY procedure.

seg-source.mrk: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB for system-wide operations, but using an individual database's to authenticate connections to that database.
This value must be set by using system-wide JVM properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY procedure.

target.mrk: NATIVE authentication using credentialsDB for system-wide operations, but using an individual database's to authenticate connections to that database.
This value must be set by using system-wide JVM properties or by using the derby.properties file; it cannot be set in the database by using the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY procedure.

seg-source.mrk: LDAP

target.mrk: LDAP

seg-source.mrk: An external LDAP directory service.

target.mrk: An external LDAP directory service.

seg-source.mrk: A complete Java class name

target.mrk: A complete Java class name

trans-unit.source: A user-defined class that provides user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: A user-defined class that provides user authentication.

target.mrk: A user-defined class that provides user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: BUILTIN

target.mrk: BUILTIN

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s simple internal user authentication repository.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s simple internal user authentication repository.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases. It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication. It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these settings, see "Using NATIVE authentication" and "External directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about these settings, see "Using NATIVE authentication" and "External directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information about these settings, see "Using NATIVE authentication" and "External directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: To enable any user authentication setting other than NATIVE, you must set the derby.connection.requireAuthentication property to true. If you specify NATIVE authentication, behaves as if the derby.connection.requireAuthentication and derby.database.sqlAuthorization properties were also set.

seg-source.mrk: To enable any user authentication setting other than NATIVE, you must set the derby.connection.requireAuthentication property to true.
If you specify NATIVE authentication, behaves as if the derby.connection.requireAuthentication and derby.database.sqlAuthorization properties were also set.

target.mrk: To enable any user authentication setting other than NATIVE, you must set the derby.connection.requireAuthentication property to true.
If you specify NATIVE authentication, behaves as if the derby.connection.requireAuthentication and derby.database.sqlAuthorization properties were also set.

trans-unit.source: When using NATIVE authentication, you can also set the following related properties:

seg-source.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, you can also set the following related properties:

target.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, you can also set the following related properties:

trans-unit.source: When using NATIVE authentication, the database owner calls the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativecreateuserproc.dita#rrefnativecreateuserproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</xref></codeph> system procedure to create users, and can also call the following additional user management procedures:

seg-source.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, the database owner calls the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativecreateuserproc.dita#rrefnativecreateuserproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</xref></codeph> system procedure to create users, and can also call the following additional user management procedures:

target.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, the database owner calls the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativecreateuserproc.dita#rrefnativecreateuserproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</xref></codeph> system procedure to create users, and can also call the following additional user management procedures:

seg-source.mrk: <codeph><xref href="rrefnativedropuserproc.dita#rrefnativedropuserproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER</xref></codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph><xref href="rrefnativedropuserproc.dita#rrefnativedropuserproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER</xref></codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph><xref href="rrefnativeresetpasswordproc.dita#rrefnativeresetpasswordproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD</xref></codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph><xref href="rrefnativeresetpasswordproc.dita#rrefnativeresetpasswordproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD</xref></codeph>

trans-unit.source: When using NATIVE authentication, any user can call the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativemodifypasswordproc.dita#rrefnativemodifypasswordproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_MODIFY_PASSWORD</xref></codeph> system procedure to change that user's password.

seg-source.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, any user can call the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativemodifypasswordproc.dita#rrefnativemodifypasswordproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_MODIFY_PASSWORD</xref></codeph> system procedure to change that user's password.

target.mrk: When using NATIVE authentication, any user can call the <codeph><xref href="rrefnativemodifypasswordproc.dita#rrefnativemodifypasswordproc">SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_MODIFY_PASSWORD</xref></codeph> system procedure to change that user's password.

trans-unit.source: For more information about user authentication, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about user authentication, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information about user authentication, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: When using an external authentication service provider (LDAP), you must also set:

seg-source.mrk: When using an external authentication service provider (LDAP), you must also set:

target.mrk: When using an external authentication service provider (LDAP), you must also set:

seg-source.mrk: derby.authentication.server

target.mrk: derby.authentication.server

trans-unit.source: When using LDAP, you can set other LDAP-specific properties. See also:

seg-source.mrk: When using LDAP, you can set other LDAP-specific properties.
See also:

target.mrk: When using LDAP, you can set other LDAP-specific properties.
See also:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can write your own class to provide a different external authentication service. This class must implement the public interface org.apache.derby.authentication.UserAuthenticator and throw exceptions of the type java.sql.SQLException where appropriate. Using a user-defined class makes adaptable to various naming and directory services. For example, the class could allow to hook up to an existing user authentication service that uses any of the standard directory and naming service providers to JNDI.

seg-source.mrk: Alternatively, you can write your own class to provide a different external authentication service.
This class must implement the public interface org.apache.derby.authentication.UserAuthenticator and throw exceptions of the type java.sql.SQLException where appropriate.
Using a user-defined class makes <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> adaptable to various naming and directory services.

For example, the class could allow <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to hook up to an existing user authentication service that uses any of the standard directory and naming service providers to JNDI.

target.mrk: Alternatively, you can write your own class to provide a different external authentication service.
This class must implement the public interface org.apache.derby.authentication.UserAuthenticator and throw exceptions of the type java.sql.SQLException where appropriate.
Using a user-defined class makes <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> adaptable to various naming and directory services.

For example, the class could allow <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to hook up to an existing user authentication service that uses any of the standard directory and naming service providers to JNDI.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: derby.authentication.provider={ NATIVE:credentialsDB | NATIVE:credentialsDB:LOCAL | LDAP | BUILTIN | classProviderName }

target.mrk: derby.authentication.provider={ NATIVE:credentialsDB | NATIVE:credentialsDB:LOCAL | LDAP | BUILTIN | classProviderName }

seg-source.mrk: Default

target.mrk: Default

seg-source.mrk: No authentication.

target.mrk: No authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Example

target.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: -- system-wide property derby.authentication.provider=NATIVE:MyCredsDB:LOCAL -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.provider', 'LDAP')

seg-source.mrk: -- system-wide property derby.authentication.provider=NATIVE:MyCredsDB:LOCAL -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.provider', 'LDAP')

target.mrk: -- system-wide property derby.authentication.provider=NATIVE:MyCredsDB:LOCAL -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.provider', 'LDAP')

seg-source.mrk: Dynamic or static

target.mrk: Dynamic or static

trans-unit.source: Static. For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect. For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.

seg-source.mrk: Static.
For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect.
For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.

target.mrk: Static.
For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect.
For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.
